## 
<div style="font-size: 50%;">
```{r}
library(DT)
library(MASS)

data(cats, package="MASS")

data <- data.frame(
  Sex = cats$Sex,
  `Body weight` = cats$Bwt,
  `Heart weight` = cats$Hwt
)

datatable_output <- datatable(data, options = list(pageLength = 5, autoWidth = TRUE), rownames = FALSE)


htmltools::tags$div(
  style = "overflow-y: auto; max-height: 500px;",
  datatable_output
)
```

</div>
This is the cats dataset, from the `MASS` package [@MASS].

---

## Interactive Plot of Cats

```{r}
library(plotly)

fig <- plot_ly(
  data = cats,
  x = ~Bwt,
  y = ~Hwt,
  type = 'scatter',
  mode = 'markers',
  marker = list(size = 8)
) %>%
  layout(
    title = "Cats body and heart weights",
    xaxis = list(title = "Body weight (kg)"),
    yaxis = list(title = "Heart Weight (g)"),
    hovermode = "closest",
    width = 1000,  # Adjust the width as needed
    height = 450, # Adjust the height as needed
    hovermode = "closest"
  )


fig
```

Placing the cursor on top of the datapoints will display the exact X and Y values.

## Code 

Fitting a linear model to see how Heart weight depends on Body weight

```{r}
#| eval: FALSE
#| echo: TRUE



cat_lm <- lm(Hwt ~ Bwt, data = cats)
summary(cat_lm)


```
